remarks.remark: Sandy has over twenty one years experience in the Westchester real estate market. Sandy is a lifetime resident of Rye and has been a top producing agent for the last decade. Her knowledge of the local marketplace provides her clients with a distinctive edge in the purchase or sale of real estate. Sandy has a notable percentage of repeat business from satisfied clients. It would be difficult to overstate Sandy's talent in negotiating or her determination and enthusiasm for the success of her clients. Sandy is a member of the National Association of Realtors, New York State Association of Realtors, Westchester Putnam Board of Realtors and Rye-Harrison Multiple Listing Service.Call Sandy today to discuss your real estate goals.

remarks.remark: Carola Schonander has had extensive training in Real Estate. Her eagerness, professionalism and enthusiasm has already led to many closed transactions. Her previous career in journalism and marketing took her from her native Venezuela to London, New York, Lima and Mexico City. She moved to Larchmont in 2001 with her Swedish-born husband and their three children. As well as speaking Spanish and Italian, Carola has strong international connections, a valuable asset in this diverse community. She has developed deep roots in the local community, and understands the needs of newcomers, having relocated on many occasions. She belongs to the Church of St. John and St. Paul and is a member of the Orienta Beach Club, New Rochelle Racquet Club and New York Road Runners.

office.name: William Pitt Sotheby's International Realty
William Pitt Sotheby's International Realty

remarks.remark: Serving as the capstone to a 20-year career in real estate, Rick Distel joined the Washington Depot office of Sotheby's International Realty in 2008, where he consistently ranks as one of the marketplace’s top-producing agents. Distel brings an unmatched passion for marketing luxury homes to the western Connecticut region. Leveraging the power of the Sotheby’s International Realty brand is a cornerstone of his strategy. Highly regarded by his peers throughout the Sotheby’s International Realty network, Distel acts as an Ambassador to the brand and is often referred to as “Mr. Sotheby’s”. He shares his passion for luxury marketing by mentoring new agents in the Litchfield, Fairfield and Westchester County marketplaces, he presents a training module to new agents throughout the William Pitt | Sotheby’s International Realty and Julia B. Fee | Sotheby’s International Realty network, and he has been a frequent guest speaker at offices in Fairfield County, Westchester County and Manhattan. In 2017 Distel was a bestowed a keynote speaking engagement at the Sotheby’s Global Networking Event in Las Vegas, attended by over 2,400 of the firm’s top producing global agents. One category he is well known for is his talk titled “The Art of the Showing” which dives into the importance of private showings. Distel’s success in real estate is rooted in his passion for luxury real estate and architecture. While he has represented and sold across the architectural disciplines, Distel is one of the firm’s mid-century modern experts, a style he reveres personally and can represent with proficiency. In recent years alone, his notable sales include Marcel Breuer’s “Stillman II”, John Johansen’s “Huvelle House” and Edward Larrabee Barnes’ “Marsters House”. After moving to New York and receiving his MBA in Real Estate and Finance from NYU's Leonard N. Stern School of Business, he worked as a consultant at Ernst & Young, where he specialized in large-scale real estate asset acquisitions and dispositions, performed due diligence and strategic advisory services, and provided valuations of closely held real estate companies. In 2000, he co-founded a private real estate equity fund that focused in New York's downtown neighborhoods. Distel joined Sotheby’s International Realty in 2008. The Rick Distel | Private Client Group was formed in 2016 to underscore a commitment to delivering a superior client experience. Each member of the team embodies this unwavering commitment. Distel is also a licensed salesperson in the state of California, where he is licensed with Pacific | Sotheby’s International Realty’s Palm Springs office. This affiliation allows Distel to expand his service commitment to his bi-coastal and international clientele. Rick and his husband live at Hedgelawn Farm, a certified organic farm in Washington, Connecticut which provides fruits and vegetables to local eateries and to the community. They have two incredible rescue pups: Cooper and Dodger.

remarks.remark: Larry Garguilo was born and raised in Brooklyn living in both Red Hook and Park Slope while being lucky enough to spend his summers on Rogers Lake in Old Lyme Ct. His family can make a unsubstantiated claim to being one of the first weekenders in Connecticut. These summers in Connecticut convinced him that that this was where he wanted to live and he has spent most of the last 40 years in Connecticut living in Kent and Roxbury.Larry has been involved in real estate since the late 80's when he had held his license at George Davis Realty in New Preston. He also has a working knowledge of the development process as he has purchased raw land and gone through the subdivision and construction process while overseeing the building of two homes in Litchfield County. He has also gained valuable knowledge being "married" to real estate over the last 25 years as his wife Bonnie is a top agent at Litchfield Hills Sotheby's Intl. Realty in Washington Depot.Larry has worked for nearly 40 years as an IT professional. The last 15 years were spent with Honeywell as a Program Manager and Project Lead. He has worked on projects in Canada, Mexico and the US with worldwide support. While at Honeywell he worked on a number of Habitat for Humanity projects and is currently involved in the local chapter.

remarks.remark: Joe assists buyers in gaining knowledge and awareness of the shoreline and Connecticut River valley to make an informed decision as to where they want to purchase their home whether year round or vacation and weekend getaway. He works with property owners to determine market value and develop a marketing plan to realize maximum value in a reasonable time. Having spent his summers on the shoreline and a good part of my adult life, Joe can assist buyers coming into the area in getting a quick primmer as to resources, cultural activities, transportation, etc. Utilizing his past business and real estate success, Joe brings buyers and sellers together in win-win transactions.

remarks.remark: Through her drive and commitment to be the very best, Julia is a leader in her market and an expert in bringing her buyers and sellers together. Her enthusiasm, courteousness and professionalism make the process of buying and selling real estate an enjoyable experience. Specializing in residential properties and new construction, Julia is ready to guide and assist her clients in making their dreams come true. Julia has over 25 years of real estate experience as an Associate Broker with Sotheby’s International Realty. She is a member of the Westchester Putnam Multiple Listing Service and the National Association of Realtors (NAR), and is a Graduate of the Realtor Institute(GRI). Julia graduated from St. John’s University with a Bachelor of Science degree. Prior to her career in real estate, she worked in public and private accounting. Her family is in the residential and commercial building industry, and after starting a family Julia transitioned into the real estate business. She has consistently utilized her knowledge of taxation to assist home buyers and sellers. Julia prides herself on her dedication to her clients and customers and their needs, whether they are considering buying or selling homes. Her marketing and negotiation skills, along with her experience and area knowledge, are the key components to delivering the services clients and customers deserve.

remarks.remark: Informed Focus Kathryn Clair attributes her long-standing success as one of the top agents at William Pitt Sotheby's International Realty to consistently satisfying the needs of her clients, while making a commitment to provide an outstanding level of service. A strong record of repeat business is her trademark and she enjoys her continued connection with her clients. Awards She is an eleven-time recipient of the Connecticut Magazine, Five Star Real Estate Agent Award for delivering an exceptional level of client service, which is awarded to only 7% of all Connecticut Real Estate Agents. Other awards include Top Office Producer, #1 Dollar Volume, #1 Units, William Pitt Sotheby's International Diamond Award Winner, William Pitt Sotheby's International Platinum Award Winner, William Pitt Sotheby's International Gold Award Winner and William Pitt Sotheby's International Silver Award Winner. Notable Sales Michael J. Fox Estate, Joan Rivers Estate, Deborah Harry Estate, Colgate Mansion, William Styron Estate, Walter Matthau Estate, Arlene Francis Estate, Henri Bendel's CEO Geraldine Stutz Gibbs Estate. Experience Over 18 years of experience in all price ranges, she strives to connect the buyer with the property which works best for their lifestyle and helps them navigate through the buying process. For sellers, she brings her knowledge and top marketing skills to achieve the goal of a successful sale of their home. Local Involvement With her depth of local involvement, she offers great knowledge of local and private schools, area activities for children and adults, local contractors and service providers, all which creates a seamless transition to a new area for her client. She is a graduate of Rutgers University with a degree in Business/Economics and continued graduate study at the University of Texas in Psychology. Kathryn served two terms on the Region 12 Board of Education, where she held both Treasurer and Finance Chairman positions. Commitment to Giving Back She was a charter member of the After School Arts Project Fundraising Board, Co-Chair of The Lake Waramaug House Tour to benefit New Milford Hospital and the Lake Waramaug Task Force, The Roxbury Bicentennial Committee, Region 12 PTO, Booth Free Fall Festival, Member of the Washington Art Association, National Association of Realtors, Connecticut Association of Realtors, Litchfield County Board of Realtors, New Milford Board of Realtors and continues to contribute in a host of area events. She and her husband Tim raised their four children in Litchfield County and find it to be one of the most beautiful areas on the East Coast, offering a combination of both beauty and easy access to New York City and Boston.

remarks.remark: Bonnie Garguilo is an award-winning Realtor with over 30 years of experience in greater Litchfield County residential real estate. The key to her success is exceptional service, clear communication, detailed feedback & consistent follow up. In a highly competitive field she is respected by her peers and has developed professional relationships that are beneficial in complex real estate transactions. Bonnie specializes in all aspects of residential real estate with emphasis on luxury real estate, weekend homes, farms and lake properties. In 2012 Bonnie's husband, Larry, joined her at William Pitt Sotheby’s International Realty and they have established a team approach that has enabled them to increase sales and provide better service. Bonnie and Larry have lived in Roxbury for the past 25 years and in the Kent Hollow section of Kent for 15 years prior to that. Their daughter Megan attended Booth Free School, Washington Montessori and the Gunnery. Bonnie was a former member and past chair of the Roxbury Board of Assessment Appeals, and has been a supporter of the Roxbury Land Trust.

remarks.remark: Licensed Associate Broker for more than 25. My areas of expertise are the Sound Shore communities of Larchmont, Mamaroneck, Rye Neck, New Rochelle and Pelham. I am a dedicated professional offering meticulous attention to details and with a loyal following of first-time home buyers. I am a leader in both listings and selling. Active in the Larchmont/Mamaroneck PTA, Larchmont Junior League, Garden Club of Larchmont, Women's Club and an advocate for the disabled in the Mamaroneck school system. My four children attended the Mamaroneck school system, and my grandchildren attend the Mamaroneck and New Rochelle school systems. I have been a resident of Larchmont/Mamaroneck for 23 years and I now reside in New Rochelle. I am always available to help make the right choice in purchasing a home and directing the sale when the time comes to move on.

remarks.remark: Marcia has over 28 successful years of experience in the real estate business. She specializes in listing and selling properties in Rye, Rye Brook, Purchase, Harrison, Port Chester and White Plains. Being a long time resident, Marcia does cover other communities in Westchester County as well. Marcia prides herself on her honesty and integrity and is held in high esteem by both her clients and her customers. Marcia is a consistent top producer with sales that average over $30 million dollars. Her expertise in marketing and sales, along with her personal attention to details and concerns has contributed to her success as an Associate Broker. Throughout her career, former buyers and sellers have returned to Marcia for their real estate needs. She has built up a strong referral network. Marcia's commitment to the local communities she serves is evidenced by her continued involvement, including the formation of the Village of Rye Brook, her chairmanship of the Rye Brook Commission of Recreation and Parks and board membership in Architectural Review, Traffic, Airport and also serves on the Board of her Homeowners Association. She was on the Byram Ridge Task Force and the Comprehensive Planning Committee for Rye Brook and is a member of the Town of Rye Citizens Task Force on Assessments. She has received many awards from the Westchester MLS and NRT and is also a member of NAR and NYSAR and is in the Julia B. Fee Sotheby's International Realty Producers' Club. Marcia is featured every year in the Westchester Magazine's Five Star Program (2010-2017).

remarks.remark: Honest, Dedicated and Professional Complete commitment to client's interest Westchester Magazine 5 Star Award WinnerAs a native of Lower Westchester, Beth has first-hand knowledge of all the towns and villages and their school systems. Beth comes from a family that has its roots in Residential Real Estate. Her career started in 1979 selling homes to first time buyers and those buyers turned into repeat buyers over the years. Beth's knowledge of real estate has expanded to include all avenues of real estate. Beth has achieved numerous awards. She currently has received Westchester's Magazine's 5 Star Award for the last 4 years. This award is voted on by clients of Beth's and their rating of their experience in buying their home-their most valuable transaction. She is a Licensed Salesperson and a member of the Westchester County Board of Realtors. Beth's prior career in Interior Design has empowered her to help her sellers present their homes so that they receive the highest price possible. Her knowledge of construction and love of renovation have helped her buyers envision what "can be achieved". Beth's community activities and involvement enhance her knowledge of the areas she specializes in: Larchmont, Mamaroneck, Rye, Harrison, Purchase, Port Chester and Rye Brook. Her involvement includes Twig Antiques, The Carver Center and The Little Garden Club. She enjoys golf and bridge. She is a member of The Shenorock Shore Club and The Apawamis Club. Beth's commitment to her clients is 100 percent. She is an artful negotiator and her clients appreciate Beth's tenacity and calming influence when a transaction is being brought to fulfillment.

remarks.remark: With 30 years of real estate experience in Westchester County, Alix is one of the top sales producers in the area, every year, year after year. She spent 27 years with Julia B. Fee, 15 of them as a co-owner and principal broker before the company was acquired by Sotheby's International Realty, where she serves as a Vice President and Leader of the Alix Prince Network. The network includes Alix and her staff for pricing strategy, photography, copy writing, advertising and advanced social media, as well as extensive co-brokerage and networking groups both nationally and internationally based.<BR/><BR/>Alix has built her career on her depth of knowledge, keen negotiating skills and integrity.She is respected and admired throughout the industry.<BR/><BR/>Having handled properties at every price point including estates valued at $15 million, Alix is responsive to the individual's needs. She has worked with heads of industries, entertainment notables and politicians, as well as families, empty nesters and investors. She maintains respect for privacy and confidentiality. Her customers have shown their satisfaction through referrals and repeat business. Alix has sold and resold her clients' homes and worked with their children and grandchildren.<BR/><BR/>A lifelong resident of Westchester County, Alix has a commitment to and understanding of the area and its amenities. The proximity to Manhattan offers the best of all worlds, easy access to cultural events with the beauty and serenity of the suburbs. She is proud of the excellent schools and welcoming communities that make Westchester a superb place to raise a family and form lifelong friendships.<BR/><BR/>Alix has considerable experience with waterfront properties, builders, luxury properties and developers and is conversant in every facet of property development including permits, blueprints and codes. She has listed condominiums, cluster developments and multi-home communities.<BR/><BR/>Priding herself on her excellent listing skills and excellent listening skills, Alix relates well to people from all walks of life. She finds her clients and customers interesting and believes there is something to learn from each and every one.<BR/><BR/>Alix has achieved placement on NRT's Top 1,000 Sales Associates and has consistently earned Diamond Level Sales Awards from the Westchester County Board of Realtors. She is a member of the National Association of Realtors and Westchester County Board of Realtors. Her designations include Certified Relocation Specialist and Graduate of Realtor Institute.<BR/><BR/>Alix covers Rye, Rye Brook, Port Chester, Harrison, Purchase, West Harrison, White Plains, Larchmont, New Rochelle, Mamaroneck and Rye Neck. <BR/><BR/>
remarks.htmlRemark: With 30 years of real estate experience in Westchester County, Alix is one of the top sales producers in the area, every year, year after year. She spent 27 years with Julia B. Fee, 15 of them as a co-owner and principal broker before the company was acquired by Sotheby's International Realty, where she serves as a Vice President and Leader of the Alix Prince Network. The network includes Alix and her staff for pricing strategy, photography, copy writing, advertising and advanced social media, as well as extensive co-brokerage and networking groups both nationally and internationally based.<BR/><BR/>Alix has built her career on her depth of knowledge, keen negotiating skills and integrity.She is respected and admired throughout the industry.<BR/><BR/>Having handled properties at every price point including estates valued at $15 million, Alix is responsive to the individual's needs. She has worked with heads of industries, entertainment notables and politicians, as well as families, empty nesters and investors. She maintains respect for privacy and confidentiality. Her customers have shown their satisfaction through referrals and repeat business. Alix has sold and resold her clients' homes and worked with their children and grandchildren.<BR/><BR/>A lifelong resident of Westchester County, Alix has a commitment to and understanding of the area and its amenities. The proximity to Manhattan offers the best of all worlds, easy access to cultural events with the beauty and serenity of the suburbs. She is proud of the excellent schools and welcoming communities that make Westchester a superb place to raise a family and form lifelong friendships.<BR/><BR/>Alix has considerable experience with waterfront properties, builders, luxury properties and developers and is conversant in every facet of property development including permits, blueprints and codes. She has listed condominiums, cluster developments and multi-home communities.<BR/><BR/>Priding herself on her excellent listing skills and excellent listening skills, Alix relates well to people from all walks of life. She finds her clients and customers interesting and believes there is something to learn from each and every one.<BR/><BR/>Alix has achieved placement on NRT's Top 1,000 Sales Associates and has consistently earned Diamond Level Sales Awards from the Westchester County Board of Realtors. She is a member of the National Association of Realtors and Westchester County Board of Realtors. Her designations include Certified Relocation Specialist and Graduate of Realtor Institute.<BR/><BR/>Alix covers Rye, Rye Brook, Port Chester, Harrison, Purchase, West Harrison, White Plains, Larchmont, New Rochelle, Mamaroneck and Rye Neck. <BR/><BR/>

She works in the diverse market of Westchester County which requires a multi-faceted sales professional who enjoys the wide range of people with various needs. She is committed to privacy and confidentiality in all business matters. Gerarda plays a big part in fund raising for Autism Speaks and is Committee Head for The Law Firm of Filannino and Tiangco, LLPs Annual Golf Outing which benefits Autism Speaks. To contact Gerarda call her at 914.434.5074 or email her at gerarda.tiangco@juliabfee.com. Her office is located in the heart of the Village of Scarsdale at 28 Chase Road, Scarsdale, NY 10583.

remarks.remark: Who doesn't love real estate? It's a force that drives economies around the globe. When you are looking for excellent service and care "Go ask Alice!" I have over 11 years experience as a licensed real estate salesperson. Passionate and with a rich life experience, having been married for 35 years and raising 6 children, I dedicate myself each day to my clients and their needs. With total sales exceeding $140,000,000, I have achieved Top Producer status at Julia B Fee Sotheby's International Realty. I'm excited to be connecting with buyers and sellers not just in Westchester County, but around the world. Teaming up with Sotheby's International Realty agents across the world, I've been able to bring many resources and my expertise to the buying and selling process. My motto is "One source, unlimited resources". For a truly exceptional real estate experience, please contact me any time. I am a full-time, full-service real estate agent, and look forward each day to working for and with my clients.

remarks.remark: Diana has lived in Larchmont Manor with her husband and 4 daughters for 25 years. She has been selling real estate in the Sound Shore communities of Larchmont, Mamaroneck and Rye for over 15 years. Before becoming a top producer with Julia B Sotheby's, Diana spent 10 years with Ted Bates Advertising in NY and London, managing global clients that included M & M Mars and Colgate Palmolive. The marketing skills she acquired during those years are important to her Seller clients as they inform the strategy she uses in staging, pricing and marketing their homes. Diana believes strongly that much of the work in selling a home, is done upfront. She spends a good deal of her time with her clients studying the market place, the competition and the buyers. She also spends a good deal of that upfront time helping her clients prepare their home for today's marketplace. Her resources are comprehensive and invaluable. On the part of Buyer clients, Diana's background in client service has meant a greatly appreciated level of attentiveness and professionalism. She knows that her buyers require 'up to the minute' listings and sales information as well as an agent that listens closely to what they are looking for. The financial and personal implications in buying a home are substantial and the decisions her clients make require time and thoughtful consideration. A respected and active member of her community, Diana served on the Board of The French American School for 9 years during which time her 4 daughters were students there. (They later attended Mamaroneck High School and Rye Country day School). Diana has been a strong supporter of the Leukemia Lymphoma Society, Cornell Weill/Columbia Presbyterian Hospital, The Larchmont Library and several Long Island Sound environmental charities. She founded the New Suffolk Waterfront Fund in 2005. Diana earned her BA in History from Vassar College. She is fluent in Greek and has a limited fluency in French and Spanish. She is a member of the Greek Orthodox Church of Our Saviour in Harrison NY and in her free time she loves to play golf, swim and garden.

William Pitt Sotheby's International Realty

remarks.remark: Leslie has been awarded the FIVE STAR Real Estate Agent Award by Connecticut Magazine for each of the past 8 years. This award was based on the following criteria: customer service, communication, finding the right home, integrity, marketing the home, market knowledge, closing preparation and overall satisfaction. The numbers for this award came from a survey of present and past clients and the award goes to the top 7% of agents. The foundation of Leslie's success has been her dedication to customer satisfaction, earning her the respect and confidence of her clients. Leslie is known to be creative, a good listener, and a seasoned negotiator. Her market expertise and prompt response to client's needs have brought her repeat business and referrals. An active Realtor in the shoreline area since 1997, Leslie joined William Pitt Sotheby's International Realty in 2010 and is excited to be with the internationally recognized brand and with a local office recognized for excellence. Before and after joining William Pitt Sotheby's, Leslie has been recognized for her success in real estate sales with a number of awards, and with a luxury property designation. Leslie grew up in Milford, CT and moved to Killingworth where she raised her children. After that she lived in Old Lyme and Madison before moving to Essex, where she has resided for many years. Since beginning her real estate career, Leslie and her husband have bought and sold six homes which when purchased were in need of renovation. They found the process of redesigning and renovating to be very fulfilling, and the experience to be quite helpful in advising clients. Having resided in a number of area towns has given Leslie the knowledge that has enabled her to sell real estate from Branford to Stonington and along the Connecticut River. A member of the National Association of Realtors, the Connecticut Association of Realtors, and the New Haven Board of Realtors, Leslie is continually honing her skills through continued education. She has earned the GRI (Graduate Realtor Institute) designation. Leslie is a member of the Essex Corinthian Yacht Club, the Connecticut River Museum and The Essex Historical Society.

remarks.remark: From her earliest days as a real estate agent, Penny had a talent for meeting her clients' needs. In her first year she was awarded Rookie of the Year, and ever since has been among the top-producing agents in the Westchester communities she serves. Penny's education and career, beginning with her B.A. degree in Sociology, has always been oriented toward providing people with sound advice and guidance. She has been a placement director for The New School in New York City, has managed her own interior design business, was an executive relocation manager covering the tri-state area and since 1986 has been a full-time residential real estate professional. With her wide range of experience, plus living in Larchmont since 1979, Penny has an in-depth knowledge of home values and market fluctuations. She educates her customers, enabling them to identify the most appropriate communities for their needs. As added value, she uses her years as an interior designer to assist clients with preparations for the sale of their homes, and advises buyers about the potential of their prospective new ones. Her ultimate goal is identifying what's best for the entire family and finding the right choice for everyone.

remarks.remark: Sue has been a resident of Litchfield for over 50 years and has practiced selling real estate in the Northwest corner of Connecticut for over 40 years, 29 with her own brokerage firm, Sue Doyle Country Properties.Sue has always been in the top 90% for listings and sales in the Litchfield area and has been recognized for several years by CT Magazine as a five star real estate professional for delivering an exceptional level of client service.Sue was the first woman to serve on the Litchfield Borough Town Council and was a past director at Litchfield Bancorp. She has also continually served on various boards for the Litchfield County Board of Realtors and has earned her GRI and CRS designations. Locally she is involved in many activities and groups.A few testimonials from happy clients:"We were first time home buyers who had engaged many agents before Sue, and no one was as candid, knowledgeable, and helpful as she has been. She has educated us on every house. Sue pointed out what was well built, what was lacking, what we should take into consideration. She was constantly available to schedule viewings and answer questions. Sue has continued to guide our home ownership by providing much needed advice after the purchase. Sue is the kind of agent every buyer hopes to find, and will return to for every real estate need" Natasa Lekic"When we bought our house in Litchfield ten years ago, Sue Doyle actually represented the seller. She impressed us so much that when we listed our house for sale we knew exactly who to call. Sue is everything you want in a realtor. Her integrity, dedication, knowledge of the area, and experience are exceptional. She puts hers client's needs first and strives to meet them through the invariably stressful process of buying or selling a home. We cannot speak highly enough about Sue Doyle and can say with confidence, she's the best!" Ken & Patty Cupp

remarks.remark: Ellen is a friendly and welcoming professional who prides herself on listening carefully to her customers to ensure that she satisfies their needs and fully understands their priorities. With 20 years of experience on Wall Street, Ellen has a deep understanding and a wide range of experience working with sophisticated local as well as international customers. She meets every challenge with diligence and determination. A Rye resident for over 20 years, Ellen and her family are involved members of the community. Whether it is conducting alumni interviews for Vanderbilt University, volunteering in the Rye High School Guidance Department or serving as an officer at Manursing Island Beach Club, Ellen’s in depth knowledge of the local real estate market and the communities she serves have produced consistently satisfied customers. Ellen believes today’s web based marketing and the critical role it plays in marketing one’s home to the widest audience possible is key to maximizing returns for her clients. On the buy side, Ellen will maximize all available resources to ensure that her clients have what they need to make the best decision for themselves and their families. With her dual licenses in both New York and Connecticut, she is able to provide invaluable perspective which serve to enhance her client’s knowledge base. Ellen is a member of the Rye-Harrison Board of Realtors, New York State Association of Realtors ,National Association of Realtors and Westchester Board of Realtors. She is a licensed Accredited Buyers Representative who is always available and happy to share her insights. Ranked among the top five percent of all agents company-wide 2016

remarks.remark: Business PhilosophyI am Christine Doyle a full time global real estate advisor with William Pitt Sotheby's International Realty. As a listing agent, I have the tools and marketing to get your home sold in the shortest amount of time. With my Mom, Sue, being a real estate broker for over 45 years I have developed the passion to work in real estate and to assist clients and customers with all of their needs. I am committed to getting the best results for my clients, making the home buying & selling process a stress free, positive experience. My goal on every single transaction is to exceed my client's expectations. Areas of ExpertiseListings, Sales and Rentals of Residential Properties. I am direct, fair, and honest with my clients and customers. Having grown up and living in Litchfield County my knowledge of the area is extensive. Communities I Serve: I specialize in Litchfield, Bantam, Northfield, Morris, Goshen, Winsted/Winchester, Colebrook, Norfolk, New Hartford, Barkhamsted, Torrington and Harwinton (Litchfield County). I further specialize in all Litchfield County lake properties and have extensive knowledge of Highland Lake, West Hill Lake, Bantam Lake, Woodridge Lake, Doolittle Lake, Hartland Pond and Lake Warmaug. Personal BackgroundI retired as an Office Manager and Legal Assistant with a prestigious law firm in Litchfield County after 30 years to focus full time on my real estate goals. I have extensive experience with clients on a day to day basis. After going full time my mom, Sue Doyle and I formed "The Doyle Team" and are thrilled with our results. I have been a real estate agent in Litchfield County for 13 years. In my spare time I enjoy gardening, the ocean, and family.

remarks.remark: Tyler O' Hazo, a lifelong resident of Litchfield County, is an expert in the analysis and valuation of antique, equestrian, and water influence as well as architecturally-significant homes from within the hills of western Connecticut – arguably one of the most complex real estate markets on the eastern seaboard. Further augmenting his regional expertise, Tyler’s parents, Andrew O'Hazo Sr. and Eileen O’Hazo, previously owned and operated a real estate brokerage in Litchfield County for 20+ years before retiring from the industry. A University of Connecticut graduate, Tyler earned a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology. Considering the nature of his degree, his intrinsic desire for collaborating with people, and his exposure to his parent’s profession, it was clear that Tyler would pursue a career as a Licensed Residential Real Estate Appraiser. Tyler later advanced to a Certified Residential Real Estate Appraiser where he earned the credentials to sponsor, train, and manage a large staff of licensed real estate appraisers. As the previous Managing Partner of O'Hazo Appraisal Services, LLC., Tyler has more than 20 years’ of highly specialized experience in the valuation of a wide variety of property types in Litchfield and Fairfield Counties. Litchfield County is notable for its scenic appeal and vintage, colonial style dwellings. Attributable to its proximity to New York City, many homes within this incredibly unique area are utilized as secondary homes, many by renowned members of the entertainment industry, art community, entrepreneurs, dignitaries, and international business leaders. With previous experience assisting clientele in appraisal projects designed for financial reporting, probate, tax assessment appeal, land donation, consulting, municipal data collection, and complex litigation, Tyler has expanded his real estate services to include the representation of buyers and sellers with a direct approach that is balanced with patience, integrity and enthusiasm. Earning recognition as a member of the appraisal roster for the Federal Housing Authority as well as the Department of Housing and Urban Development, Tyler is also honored to assist members of the Armed Forces through his role as designated appraiser for the Department of Veterans Affairs. An active community member, Tyler volunteers for Friends of Futbol International, a nonprofit organization that provides funds and support to assist young soccer players in undeveloped areas all over the world. Additionally, Tyler has been appointed to the Washington Conservation Commission, is a member of the Litchfield County Blues Soccer Team within the SASL Soccer League and a supporting member of numerous local land trust organizations. Tyler is a resident of Washington, Connecticut. He enjoys boating on Lake Waramaug and Bantam Lake. Do not hesitate to contact Tyler directly for any real estate questions, if you would like a suggestion for a local restaurant, or if you just want to chat about the local marketplace. Direct-860-248-9181, daytime and evenings.

Additionally, Tyler has been appointed to the Washington Conservation Commission, is a member of the Litchfield County Blues Soccer Team within the SASL Soccer League and a supporting member of numerous local land trust organizations.<BR/><BR/>Tyler is a resident of Washington, Connecticut. He enjoys boating on Lake Waramaug and Bantam Lake. Do not hesitate to contact Tyler directly for any real estate questions, if you would like a suggestion for a local restaurant, or if you just want to chat about the local marketplace. Direct-860-248-9181, daytime and evenings.<BR/><BR/>

remarks.remark: Mary is an agent serving Larchmont, Mamaroneck and Rye Neck. Specializing in first time buyers, relocation, buying up, trading down and luxury properties, she is committed to client service, bringing enthusiasm, intelligence and experience to the real estate buying and selling process. Her goals are to inspire confidence and achieve outstanding transactional results while introducing clients to the many resources and opportunities of the Sound Shore area. Mary moved to Larchmont from Los Angeles in 1991. "We moved East on a two-year plan but stayed because we loved the lifestyle and community so much." She and her husband raised two boys who attended the Larchmont/Mamaroneck schools. She's active in the community and has served on the PTA and boards of many local organizations. A realtor since 2000, Mary attributes her consistent success to referrals and repeat customers. "My clients are loyal and many become friends. Their trust and continued support keeps building my business." Prior to real estate, Mary was a corporate communications executive in the entertainment industry. For six years, she operated a public relations consulting business. She is a cum laude graduate of UCLA.

remarks.remark: Sandra Goldfarb brings an international flair and broad real estate experience to Julia B. Fee Sotheby's International Realty. Born in England, raised in Montreal, Sandy started her real estate career in Southampton, NY, over 25 years ago. From there Sandy transitioned to the New York City Co-op and Condo market. A resident of Larchmont for the past 25 years, Sandy knows every inch of the terrain and has a knowledge of our market which can only be had by living, working and raising a family here. As along term Julia B. Fee Sotheby's International Realty agent, Sandy has seen and experienced every type of market fluctuation and has an unmatched feel for value in our community. If you want a high profile and highly respected agent to list your home or find you a home in Larchmont, Sandy Goldfarb fits the bill.

remarks.remark: As a lifelong resident of the Rye-Harrison area, Debbie has exceptional insight into both communities as well as the surrounding villages of Port Chester, Rye Brook, and Mamaroneck Prior to entering the real estate industry in 2008, Debbie spent over 15 years teaching in the Harrison Central School District and neighboring parochial schools. These experiences served as a foundation for building a wealth of knowledge about local schools, neighborhoods, and housing options. When time allows, she will substitute in the Rye district to keep up with educational trends. Debbie now continually builds knowledge of the Sound Shore communities by assisting a myriad of clients especially first time home buyers who can appreciate the individual attention and care that Debbie provides her clients. Debbie is an Alumni of Harrison High School, St. Bonaventure University, and Manhattanville College. Two of her three daughters have graduated from the Rye City School District, and the youngest is still actively enjoying Rye Middle School. Community involvement is a huge priority in Debbie's life and she is engaged in many aspects. She is a board member of the Rye Girls Softball League and leads the Umpires as their coordinator. Debbie serves as a client coordinator and volunteer for The Wig Exchange-a service organization for cancer patients going through chemotherapy as well as a volunteer member of Sole Ryeders and Friends Organization. For many years, Debbie was a Catechist for Resurrection Parish and continues to actively volunteer when needed. She is a member of the Denison University Parents Club and has assisted with recruiting in our area. Debbie also has a vast history of volunteerism for many PTO related committees throughout her family's many years in the Rye City School District. Her family enjoys and supports both the Rye Golf Club and the Rye YMCA. Having owned and renovated homes in both Rye and Harrison, the Nye family is grateful to be part of such outstanding communities.

remarks.remark: Carol Cusano is praised by clients for her honest guidance, thorough service, and exceptional results as a caring, savvy real estate professional. Specializing in the Greater New Haven area and the entire shoreline market area where she has lived since 1971, she is an expert at navigating clients through each step of the real estate process. As one happy client put it, "I've worked with many realtors and you've simply been the best! Your knowledge of the market and adherence to my requirements regarding features and finances greatly expedited my long distance search for a home in Connecticut. That you were always available and stayed by me until closing was also much appreciated." Carol's success with her clients stems from her strong belief in always being prepared to accomplish anything in life. It is this philosophy that has guided her to her chosen paths of business from her work in mortgage banking in financing and management, to her years as a real estate paralegal for a major New Haven law firm. Her understanding of real estate combined with exceptional knowledge as a lifelong New Haven area resident gives Carol a distinct edge as the realtor of choice for anyone looking for a home in the Greater New Haven Area, including the Yale and Quinnipiac communities, as well as the shoreline neighborhoods in the towns of East Haven, Branford, Guilford, Madison, Clinton, Westbrook and Old Saybrook. As a member of the Real Estate Buyer's Agent Council, Carol holds a professional designation as an Accredited Buyer's Representative (ABR), a member of the National Assoc. of Realtors, the Connecticut Assoc. of Realtors, and the Greater New Haven Assoc. of Realtors. She is a former member of the Board of Directors for the Shoreline Chamber of Commerce and is presently serving as a member of the Board of Assessment Appeals for the Town of Guilford. Carol is the recipient of the 2013 Distinguished Service Award of the Shoreline Chamber of Commerce and the 2009 Volunteer of the Year Award of the Shoreline Chamber of Commerce. She is the former Chairperson of the Women in Business Committee and former Vice Chair of the Membership Committee of the Shoreline Chamber of Commerce. William Pitt Sotheby’s International Realty has awarded Carol with its Gold, Silver and Bronze Production Awards.

remarks.remark: Pat Kennedy Lahoud is one of the top luxury brokers in Litchfield County. Pat was voted one of Litchfield County's "Most Influential People of 2015" along with her husband, Joe Lahoud, a 14 year major league baseball veteran where he played for the Red Sox, Kansas City Royals, Milwaukee Brewers California Angels and Texas Rangers clubs. She has personal connections with high end brokers in New York City, globally and a portfolio of diverse clientele including celebrities, professional athletes and business icons.<BR/><BR/>Pat joined Sotheby’s International Realty in 2001 and is passionate about the global reach and intuitive marketing that see is able to harness to gain leverage for her clients. She has represented and sold many significant local properties including the Historic Colgate Mansion, Grey Rock Lake Waramaug estate and currently listed Hill house in Northwest CT, currently on the market at $19,975,000.<BR/><BR/>Thirty years in the international travel industry gave her the skills to understand people’s needs and respond accordingly.  Through all that travel she also developed a serious interest in architecture and design which she has applied to decorating and designing homes for herself, clients and friends for many years.  Pat remodeled an 1808 antique residence and later designed and oversaw construction of her fabulous shingle-style home overlooking Lake Waramaug and the Hopkins Vineyard. Both homes were published in three home design magazines.<BR/><BR/>Pat has a long standing history of supporting the community and feels it is especially important to give back. She was past chair of The Lake Waramaug House Tour benefiting New Milford Hospital and The Lake Waramaug Task Force. She has also championed supporting area school attended by her children including Rumsey Hall School, The Gunnery, and Avon Old Farms. Pat is also a past Director of the New Milford Board of Realtors. She has been active as a member of Ridgewood Country Club, Lake Waramaug Country Club and the Daughters of the American Revolution (DAR).<BR/><BR/>She resides in Litchfield County with her husband, Joe and three large dogs. Her two sons reside in Connecticut and Miami Florida.<BR/><BR/> <BR/><BR/>

remarks.remark: Eileen is originally from Baltimore, Maryland. She graduated from nursing school and moved to New York City. Prior to marriage Eileen was Assistant Supervisor of Nurses at Mount Sinai Hospital and remained there until the birth of her first child. E ileen and her husband, Bob, moved to Scarsdale in 1974 with their two children, Jennifer, 3, and Jonathan, 8 months. Both children had wonderful educational and social experiences matriculating through the Scarsdale school system. Eileen changed careers in 1981 when she became a licensed real estate salesperson. She has sold and listed many homes in Scarsdale and its surrounding communities for the past 28 years. She is regarded as a knowledgeable and caring professional, one who is totally experienced in the field. She understands the needs and desires of her clients and works diligently to meet those goals. She specializes in single-family homes, co-ops and condominiums. Throughout her 35-year residence in Scarsdale, Eileen has been involvedin many school and community activities, and is thoroughly familiar with life in the area. remarks.remark: Maureen Burmann has lived in Litchfield and northern Fairfield counties all her life. Architecture and real estate have always been of interest to her and she has combined those passions in her career. She has been a real estate agent since 1999 as well as a principal in a luxury home design and build company. Her expertise in home building gives her a perspective which makes her uniquely qualified to assist her clients whether they are buyers or sellers. The benefits for buyers are that she recognizes value and can help quantify attributes such as quality of construction and raw materials as well as provide guidance regarding feasibility of remodeling or expanding an existing home. For sellers she knows how to market the positives and has knowledgeable answers for potential buyers who might want to make modifications. Her goal is always to find solutions so that her clients feel satisfied and confident when making their home buying or selling decision.Maureen lives in Bridgewater with her husband and son. They are all avid sports enthusiasts and enjoy golf, tennis and skiing together.

remarks.remark: As a transplant from Manhattan, having lived there for eighteen years, Nancy is skilled at helping buyers transition from city to suburb, and working with them to find the perfect home. With an unsurpassed commitment to client service, she is here every step of the way, matching her enthusiasm with competence, and a genuine responsiveness to each client's needs.Her three daughters have all graduated from Scarsdale High School, College, and (so far) two from Graduate Schools, and she is uniquely suited to discuss the real joys of having been a soccer mom, a field hockey mom, and an active community volunteer. She was he President of he Scarsdale High School Youth Employment Service, a co-chair of the Westchester Reform Temple Religious School Board, and is currently a Board member of he Scarsdale Edgemont Family Counseling Service, and a member of the Jewish Women's Foundation.Having started her career in the retail business of women's fashion and then transitioning to Social Work she loves helping people both buying and selling their homes. Her real estate career began with selling Co-ops in Manhattan, and for the past twenty years she has sold residential real estate in Westchester. She is patient, friendly, caring, and tenacious, and demonstrates superior integrity in her business dealings. In each of her transactions she puts the needs of her clients first to insure a smooth, happy, and successful transaction.

remarks.remark: ? I have been a licensed Realtor in the State of Connecticut since 1998. I truly enjoy the day to day diversity of this profession. Each home, buyer, and transaction are different and I thrieve on seeing each one through the process from start to finish. Real Estate is not a “one size fits all” profession. Each transaction requires a unique approach, working with a longtime homeowner that needs guidance and patience getting ready to downsize is different than the first time buyer that is excited to find their first home. The real estate market has become challenging over the last few years, with so many changes in searching and locating a property. Many factors can contibute within each transaction and it’s important to be educated on them all. Insurance, mortgage and environmental factors all play into the home selling and buying process. I have knowledge in working with renters, sellers, and buyers to find the perfect property. So many of my past clients have become lifelong friends. I am pleased to offer my clients the exceptional marketing that William Pitt Sotheby’s has to offer. Our company is always on the forefront of the ever changing real estate market and has exceptional marketing programs that fit every price range and type of home. As a lifelong Shoreline resident I am very familiar with the Shoreline area and all it has to offer. I have been a Branford Resident since 1987, raising my family here. It is with enthusiasm and professionalism that I look forward to working with each and every client.

remarks.remark: Nick is affiliated with the William Pitt Sotheby's International Realty team at the Guilford, Connecticut location along with his wife Carol. Together they work as a team to fulfill the needs of clients in the greater New Haven and shoreline areas. As a CPA, he has been providing a vast array of professional financial and consulting services for over forty years to both business and individual clients. The analytical skills and tools acquired in his accounting practice enable Nick as a real estate advisor to offer clients a keen insight to realistic property valuations that enable clients to fulfill their expectations and optimize their financial objectives in a real estate transaction. You can expect the same professionalism when working with Nick as your real estate advisor that his accounting practice clients receive. He believes that to maintain a successful working relationship with his clients they be provided confidentiality and timely communications, together with practical and realistic advice for their expectations in this new era of home buying and selling. Raised in New Haven and living his married life in Branford and Guilford, Nick is quite familiar in providing clients the personal insight they seek about the greater New Haven and shoreline east communities. Besides his professional life, Nick has been able to give back to the community in his affiliations with many organizations. Among them, most notably he was Chairman of the Notre Dame High School of West Haven Board of Directors where he and his two sons attended. In addition, he has served in various Board of Director positions as an officer of The Shoreline Chamber of Commerce for over twelve years, including Chairman. There he was honored as a Volunteer of the Year and also received its Distinguished Service Award.

remarks.remark: About Me Jerry Kranz is a specialist in condominium investment and rental properties. He has owned his own real estate company for 20 years and is a resident of Stamford for over 40 years. Jerry has degrees in both English and Electrical Engineering and has held numerous positions with the Stamford Board of Realtors, including head of Ethics and Arbitration and Equal Opportunity in Housing Committees. He also has been Board President for two years and was elected "Realtor of the Year" by his peers for his voluntary contributions to the Board and the community.

remarks.remark: Susan loves living and working in the Westchester and Connecticut areas, with all its aesthetic beauty, from the beaches to hiking on some of the best trails in the county. Her area of expertise is Rye, Rye Neck, Rye Brook, Harrison, Larchmont, Purchase, and Greenwich. She is highly respected by her piers, as well as her clients. Prior to becoming a Licensed NY & CT Realtor, Susan worked as a Senior Mortgage Loan Officer for HSBC in residential mortgages, dealing with both local and international clients. She prides herself on understanding the financial side of mortgage loans, which not only helps her buyers, but also her sellers. Her goal is to deliver the highest personalized service possible and will use all of her resources, including her extensive negotiating skills, to do so. Susan is passionate towards her numerous philanthropic endeavors and is a mainstay in the Rye community. She is committed to her volunteering roles with the local Soul Ryeders & Friends (a fundraising and supportive group for people with cancer), the Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Research team, and ALS. It is through these organizations, that she has added to her meaningful business and personal connections. Susan is an avid tennis player, a tri-athlete and has a special relationship with the rowing community in Rye, RowAmerica NY and Greenwich, CT. Susan is a member of the Board of Realtors, Rye Harrison Board of Realtors, New York State Association of Realtors, Greenwich MLS and National Association of Realtors, The Woman’s Club of Rye, the Children’s Philanthropy and the Yale Club. If you want an agent who is responsive, accessible, and provides you with up-to-date market insight - reach out to Susan!

remarks.remark: Passionate about her work and enthusiastic about all that Westchester County offers. Amy brings energy, expertise, and personal commitment to every real estate transaction. Her ability to connect with buyers and sellers, converting their needs into tangible assets, has been the foundation of a successful career that began in 1983. Amy is a lifelong Northern Westchester resident; she grew up in Pound Ridge, graduated from Fox Lane High School, and is married to a Byram Hills High School alum. An avid equestrian and insightful observer, she has ridden all the trails in Northern Westchester and watched its communities change and grow enormously over the years. From Chappaqua to Armonk, Katonah to North Salem, Amy's familiarity with the area is exceptional and unmatched! Since 2009,Amy has partnered with Sotheby's Associate Broker Joanna Rizoulis to specialize in luxury properties in Northern Westchester, Putnam, and Duchess Counties. Working as a collaborative team, these two seasoned professionals provide incomparable service and the benefit of their multi-faceted skills. Their marketing expertise, in-depth knowledge of their territory, and an open-minded approach to structuring transactions inspires confidence and ensures satisfaction for both buyers and sellers. Amy and Joanna take full advantage of Sotheby's exceptional referral networks to connect with brokers locally, nationally, and globally. This expansive outreach has helped grow their business every year, despite a challenging economic environment. Their conscientious approach and dedication to every customer's needs make them a winning team To contact Amy call her at (914) 523-0678 or email her at amy.smith@juliabfee.com

remarks.remark: With 14 years of Real Estate experience in Westchester County, Joseph is one of the top sales producers in the area. His professional knowledge, experience and hands-on service he provides to his clients has led to his success. In 2009 he ranked #1 in dollar volume sold in the Harrison School District, and consistently ranks among the top in the county. Joseph has marketed and sold homes at every price point up to $20 million dollars. His main concern is exceeding the demands of today's real estate market to the benefit of each and every client. His extensive knowledge base allows Joseph to price, negotiate and market any property to its most effective potential. With his knowledge of market trends both locally and nationally, Joseph keeps his clients informed on the latest architecture, construction technology and economic conditions. Joseph has considerable experience with builders and is well versed in every facet of property development including engineering, architecture, town codes, planning boards and construction. He has worked with many local developers in locating parcels of land to develop for the construction of luxury homes. He is directly involved from the design of the house to the completion of the home. His keen knowledge of what buyers are seeking is crucial to the transaction. Joseph spends numerous hours on the job site consulting with the developer to help improve the final product. A lifelong resident in Harrison New York, Joseph attended Harrison High School and went on to receive a Bachelor of Science degree in Finance from Clarkson University. He is a father of four daughters and stays very active in the local area volunteering his time coaching youth athletic teams, and is a proud sponsor of Harrison Scholar Athletes. His commitment to the community is extended through his personal life and professional career.

remarks.remark: Susan Gilberg, a Licensed Associate Broker and consistent top producer, is committed to providing exceptional service to buyers and sellers of fine property. She ensures an effortless experience, guiding her clients through the entire sale or purchase process from beginning to end. Susan is devoted to achieving extraordinary results, and is able to reach the best possible outcome by drawing upon her powerful negotiating skills, strong instincts and keen understanding of the trends and conditions as well as economic factors that affect the marketplace. In addition, as a part of the worldwide Sotheby’s International Realty affiliate network she is able to deliver exposure for the properties she represents before a qualified base of clients in key markets across the globe. She is an expert in utilizing the most sophisticated tools and technology to effectively market her listings. Susan has frequently been recognized for her outstanding performance as well as her excellent service, receiving numerous sales awards over the course of her 15-year career in real estate. Specializing in properties in Harrison, Purchase, Rye Brook and Rye, Susan has represented buyers and sellers throughout all of Westchester County. As a lifetime resident of Harrison, Susan also has an intimate connection with Westchester County. She has proven an invaluable resource for clients, offering deep knowledge of the local communities as well as area schools and amenities. Susan brings the successful negotiation strategies, smooth transactions and superior service for which she is known from her prior experience as a top producer with Northwestern Mutual Life Insurance Company. There, in her first year out of college she won the Mike Gish Award, an honor presented to the highest producing sales agent in insurance and investment products. A graduate of Harrison High School and Syracuse University, Susan now lives in Harrison with her three children, including two with special needs. Staying involved in her community is important to Susan, and she is a board member of Heartbeet Lifesharing, a residential community for adults with developmental disabilities. In her spare time, she enjoys exercising and traveling. Susan’s professional affiliates include the Westchester County Board of Realtors, the National Association of Realtors and the Westchester Putnam Multiple Listing Service.

remarks.remark: Debby began her real estate career fifteen years ago at Burbank Whittemore, a Larchmont agency that later became Julia B. Fee Sotheby’s. Debby is thrilled to be part of company that has such a powerful global brand and yet is committed to serving the local community and region. As an agent in one of the most exciting real estate markets in the country, Debby lists, sells and rents homes in Larchmont, Mamaroneck, New Rochelle, Eastchester, Rye Neck and White Plains. When Debby and her husband began their real estate search for a great place to raise their children, they fell in love with Larchmont and all the benefits it offers, the village, parks and recreational activities, and the schools as well as its close proximity to New York City. Over the years, she and her husband became involved in a variety of community activities, including the PTA, Little League and the Larchmont Junior Soccer League. Debby served on the School Board Selection Committee, the Board of Trustees of the Westchester County Historical Society and the Vestry of St. John’s Episcopal Church. Debby started her professional career as a lawyer and has found that her legal background is a significant benefit to her clients in helping them navigate the buying and selling process. Her clients appreciate her attention to detail and her negotiating skills. But most importantly, her clients point to her ability to communicate, her tenacity and her willingness to spend whatever time is necessary to bring their real estate transaction to a satisfactory conclusion. Debby looks forward to working with you, whether you are looking to buy, sell or rent real estate in Southern Westchester County.

remarks.remark: Whether you are planning to buy, sell, rent, relocate or invest in property, I provide personalized service to help you meet your needs. Accessible and attentive, with over 20 years of experience marketing, negotiating and closing real estate transactions, I pride myself on sharing honest insight into a property’s value and desirability to empower my clients to make their move with confidence. Each city, town, and village in the region is as unique as the individual needs of my clients, and the housing market will continue to present challenges. I am dedicated to staying on top of trends and sharing the latest knowledge of new listing activity. Having served as a Hearing Officer for the Westchester County Ninth Judicial District, I am uniquely skilled at valuing property. I presided over grievance hearings for property tax assessment reductions, a position which demands expert knowledge of property valuation. A local expert with global reach, I am also a designated international property specialist. My transnational referral network is supported globally by the unparalleled marketing exposure of Sotheby's International Realty with offices in 70 countries and over 24,000 sales agents, including locations throughout the United States. I value relationships built on trust and integrity and when you are my client I go the extra mile to get the job done. Let’s connect. Contact me at 914-309-7524 or email robin.servidio@juliabfee.com. Testimonials: "I highly recommend Robin for anyone who wants a more personal buying or selling experience with someone who has vast knowledge of real estate and will do whatever it takes to create the outcome you are looking for." Larry and Lucy hired Robin to sell their home in Scarsdale. "Robin is an exceptional real estate professional and someone I trust implicitly. She always is genuine in her opinion and advice." Christina worked with Robin to purchase a home in Scarsdale. "Robin Servidio is a true professional." Jennifer hired Robin to manage the sale of her mother's estate.

remarks.remark: Ted Wiener is a native of New York and a graduate of Lehigh University, cumlaude. A United States Air Force veteran, Ted served in the Far East with the 18th Fighter Bomber Group. Subsequently he flew recreationally and as a weekend flight instructor at Westchester County Airport. Formerly he was a principle owner of an independent textile manufacturing business in New York City with sales both nationally and internationally. He is currently a member of the Professional Ski Instructors Association. Ted moved to Litchfield County in 1987. Since then, he has been dedicated to helping his clients ascertain the optimum value of their property and successfully marketing it to qualified buyers. He is also an expert at finding properties for buyers that meet their individual needs. Ted has earned the ABR, Accredited Buyer Representative, designation to evidence his success in working with buyers. He has been a consistent award-winning top producer and is a full time realtor. He is a member of the National, Connecticut, and local Boards of Realtors.

remarks.remark: Patrick Hankin has over a decade of experience as a professional residential interior designer and now focuses his career on real estate. Whether you're buying or selling, his expert eye and keen sense of style will enhance your experience. For sellers, Patrick is able to maximize the sales price for his clients by staging and redecorating. For buyers, he can help you see the possibility in properties, look beyond the furnishings, and see how one could be your new dream home. In his spare time, Patrick enjoys gourmet cooking and exploring historic mansions in the Hudson Valley and Long Island as well as spending time with his extended family throughout lower Westchester. Patrick's passion for beauty and expertise with luxury goods and services allow him to guide you through your real estate journey - finding the perfect home or the right buyers. He specializes in luxury homes in Scarsdale, Edgemont, New Rochelle, White Plains, Rye Brook and Rye.

As a lifelong resident of Harrison, Jo Ann is able to bring her knowledge of the community and all it has to offer to her clients. Jo Ann specializes in helping her clients buy and sell real estate in Harrison, Purchase, Rye, Rye Brook, Mamaroneck, White Plains, Pleasantville, Armonk and Bedford. remarks.remark: Litchfield County, located in the Northwest corner of Connecticut, is known for its remarkable scenic beauty: the Litchfield Hills, the Housatonic and Shepaug Rivers, Lake Waramaug, Bantam and Twin Lakes, The Appalachian Trail, Kent Falls and thousands of protected acres held by land trusts. These provide almost limitless opportunities for boating, swimming, fishing, hiking, downhill and cross country skiing or simply relaxing amid this bounty of natural splendor. Much of the beauty of the county is also man-made-Colonial America has been preserved in many fine homes which predate the Revolutionary War. Ancient stone walls, once defining the boundaries of farmland, now meander through second growth forests. Charming town greens mark the center of villages. There is also a rich cultural vitality: fine restaurants, a vibrant art scene, antiques dealers, artisanal food shops, a 24-stop wine trail, an annual Jazz Festival, even a film festival. This dichotomy of rural charm and simplicity and sophisticated offerings has drawn many New Yorkers to own a second, more serene home here. That most communities are less than a two-hour drive from Manhattan makes it even more attractive.Embracing our brands powerful influence, artfully uniting ex traordinary homes with extraordinary lives. Since 1744, Sotheby's has distinguished itself as a leader in the auction world. Committed to the very highest level of quality, Sotheby's sales continue to capture global attention. The Sotheby's International Realty network extends this legacy by representing exceptional real estate internationally. Our marketing strategy takes this powerful partnership and fuses them with targeted exposure achieved through our dedicated partnerships with iconic international brands such as The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, Financial Times, Bloomberg, The Telegraph and BBC. This year alone we are positioned to deliver 506 million global impressions. It's a tireless effort to cast the widest net to achieve maximum exposure for our listings, our agents and our brand. We are committed to maintaining our leadership position in our local market while also creating far-reaching global connections that transcend our competition.

These provide almost limitless opportunities for boating, swimming, fishing, hiking, downhill and cross country skiing or simply relaxing amid this bounty of natural splendor. Much of the beauty of the county is also man-made-Colonial America has been preserved in many fine homes which predate the Revolutionary War. Ancient stone walls, once defining the boundaries of farmland, now meander through second growth forests. Charming town greens mark the center of villages. There is also a rich cultural vitality: fine restaurants, a vibrant art scene, antiques dealers, artisanal food shops, a 24-stop wine trail, an annual Jazz Festival, even a film festival. This dichotomy of rural charm and simplicity and sophisticated offerings has drawn many New Yorkers to own a second, more serene home here. That most communities are less than a two-hour drive from Manhattan makes it even more attractive.Embracing our brands powerful influence, artfully uniting ex traordinary homes with extraordinary lives. Since 1744, Sotheby's has distinguished itself as a leader in the auction world. Committed to the very highest level of quality, Sotheby's sales continue to capture global attention. The Sotheby's International Realty network extends this legacy by representing exceptional real estate internationally. Our marketing strategy takes this powerful partnership and fuses them with targeted exposure achieved through our dedicated partnerships with iconic international brands such as The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, Financial Times, Bloomberg, The Telegraph and BBC. This year alone we are positioned to deliver 506 million global impressions. It's a tireless effort to cast the widest net to achieve maximum exposure for our listings, our agents and our brand. We are committed to maintaining our leadership position in our local market while also creating far-reaching global connections that transcend our competition. <BR/><BR/>

remarks.remark: Prior to becoming a licensed RealtorÂ® Donna owned and operated a successful computer company for 30 years. Over the years Donna has strived to build a business reputation of honesty, integrity and hard work which transcends into her real estate profession. Her knowledge of the Shoreline as a business owner, and her community involment, as well as her sales, marketing and financial expertise provide a unique and effective set of skills to her clients and customers. As an RealtorÂ®, Donna is committed to delivering her clients a positive and excellent customer service experience from the beginning of the transaction through closing. Donna brings her knowledge acquired as a savvy business owner and applies this in a manner that helps in the decision making process. She is effectively applying the latest technology to the local Real Estate market while providing a personal touch that is so important in all Real Estate transactions.Born and raised in Rhode Island, she moved to the Connecticut Shoreline over 35 years ago and has raised her 3 daughters here. Donna works with both Sellers and Buyers servicing East Haven, Branford, North Branford, Guilford, Madison, Clinton, Killingworth, Westbrook and Old Saybrook and specializes in residential sales, land, condos, water-oriented properties and rentals. She is knowledgeable about both the Connecticut and Rhode Island Shoreline areas. Donna is a member of the Middlesex Shoreline Board of Realtors, the Connecticut Association of Realtors and the National Association of Realtors. Professional full time Realtor, Licensed in the State of Connecticut. Contact information: (203)988-6983 cell dvaccaro@wpsir.com Donna's Reviews: CindyLu My boyfriend and I were in search of our first home. Donna was pleasant and helpful from start to finish! She was extremely patient in explaining all the processes to us and always ready to go the extra mile for our needs and wants in the house hunt. We are now in the home we fell in love with and Donna isn't just a realtor to us anymore, she's a friend! We are looking forward to keeping in touch with her and recommending her to all of our friends and family! Thanks Donna !!! You're a rockstar!!! Peter Z I met Donna via Zillow on line. I believe my first words to her I was just looking. Donna understood exactly what I was looking for and she provided some homes for me to look at. I whittled them down due to location, issues about the house I liked or disliked. This includes water well v public, septic v sewer, location, size of home and condition, I was willing to do some updating but was really trying not have much renovation but easily repairable properties. We looked at a few properties over a couple of weeks. When I walked into the home I finally bought I knew it then, if I could get the right price and cooperation from the current owner to pick up some of the repairs, after our inspector had reviewed the property would be very pleased. Donna recommended the inspector who was fantastic, knowledgeable and comes highly recommended by me as well as we did the inspection together instead of him just doing it himself. The inspector gave me a pad to write down the issues and it helped me understand all the issues that this gentleman was looking at including name, age and condition of the issues at hand. I knew how old the hot water heater, furnace, appliances, air conditioner unit etc. were. I feel if Donna Vaccaro had not been my Real Estate Agent I would still be looking for a home that I did not truly want for myself.. Donna has a true professional but has an outgoing personality which made me feel right from the start that she was the person I wanted to find me a home. She always returned my phone calls, text requests and emails very promptly. Daytime, after hours she was always responsive and a true hard worker. She kept me of her schedule but always was there when needed. She is an honest, friendly, knowledgeable agent and certainly a person I hold in high regard. I can find absolutely no faults with her process and applaud her work ethic. It took us less than a month to find the quality home of my dreams and at the price I wanted to spend for my future. Donna hit me a home run on this with her negotiating skills and the knowledge she had obtained in her chosen field, home area and life. I honestly do not believe it would have been this pleasurable to buy a home if it were not for Donna. Donna is a pleasure to work with and certainly is someone I have and will continue to recommend if you are buying or selling. I wish her the best and could not be more pleased a month into my new peaceful retreat. Tom B Donna was simply amazing and was very helpful when we relocated to CT. It was our first time renting a home in 30 years and we had a wonderful experience. She was patient and truly cares about her costumers. Her local knowledge was invaluable to our selection process. Donna didn't stop working with us until we were 100% satisfied. Her hours were flexible I would recommend a call to Donna anytime your situation requires a quality Real estate agent. Brian W Donna is awesome at her job, she is dependable,reliable and personable, she makes you feel comfortable and at ease from beginning to end. She will answer your calls or emails whether its 8 pm on a Friday or 3 pm on a Sunday, shes always there for questions.She is knowledgeable and does her research to assist in your home buying process.She really loves what she does and will be there for you every step of the way. I would recommend her to anyone looking to purchase or sell a property. Zaid A The BEST realtor in New England. Donna CONSTANTLY went out of her way to help me in any way shape or form. She is very knowledgeable and has an answer and a logical explanation to every single detail. She is extremely tech savvy which helps a lot with all that paperwork. I recommend her to anyone no matter what the need is. Louise V Donna is truly the best real estate agent I have ever had the pleasure to work with. She has integrity, heart, and an innate capacity for patience - she is kind, highly responsive and is always there to answer any questions while having my best interest in mind. She has a wonderful personality and a very pleasant demeanor - I could not ask for anything more in an agent. Myra Donna helped me with the purchase of a home I was under contract for the second time. I don't think the deal would have happened without her. Donna is very knowledgeable, hard working and honest. Shadev Donna helped guide me through purchase of a bank owned home. Very responsive and answered all questions promptly. a New test!

remarks.remark: Maxine Sanders is a licensed Associate Broker of the Larchmont office of Julia B. Fee Sotheby's International Realty. She began her real estate career in 1993 and has been a well-respected consistent top producing, multi-million dollar agent. Maxine has lived in Larchmont for 35 years and raised a family there. Her children Jason and Samantha attended the public schools and participated in the sports and arts programs. Jason is now an attorney practicing in New York City and Samantha is a filmmaker in Chicago. Maxine is also an accomplished guitarist who taught guitar for many years in Larchmont. She earned a degree in business administration from Memphis University and has traveled extensively throughout the world. She enjoys music, theater, dance, sailing and selling homes.
