remarks.remark: Dynamic personality combined with her passion for real estate and in-depth knowledge of the investment property markets results in her unique ability to get the toughest deals and most complex negotiations closed. She has been previously recognized as "ALL STAR BROKER" presented by Real Estate New York to brokers selling $70,000,000 plus in a year. Gena is established in the industry for her tenacious and analytically approach in every deal. Her vivacious personality along with long-standing relationships allows her to source creative opportunities for her clients, proven through impeccable track record. She has victoriously negotiated half a billion dollars in sales transactions through various market cycles and has expertise in investment sales. In addition, her underwriting analysis along with her ability to project future returns and forecast trends create excellent opportunities for her clients in the income producing sector, both commercial and multi-family. Some of the noteworthy and iconic transactions which Gena has been involved in include; Dobbs Ferry 262 unit apartment building on 15 acres Harrison Movie Theatre Dutchess County, Poughkeepsie 130 units Peekskill " Villa at the Woods" 184 units Fleetwood Duane Reade-20 story Development site Mamaroneck 16,000s.f. bldg One Depot Plaza Sold Mt. Vernon 66 unit apartment building Biltmore Shopping Center-Rye Brook 18,000s.f. 10 stores Larchmont 13,000 s.f. Bldg Sold an fit "Globe Bar and Grill Trinity Restaurant Bldg on Purdy Gena has a personal sphere of influence throughout New York State and has successfully completed hundreds of transactions with a varied number of developers, investors and users in a wide array of commercial real estate. Her approach to maximizing value for every client begins with a thorough understanding of the market conditions that shape investment decisions. Give GENA a call if you are looking to make a decision to buy a multi-family building or a neighborhood shopping center, lease a retail store or office , sell a business including restaurant.

remarks.remark: I was raised and educated in central Connecticut and have made the Berkshire Hills my home for over 30 years. After leaving the medical field, I found that real estate utilized many of the skills I had honed as a nurse; confidentiality, organization, time management, attention to detail and an ability to listen and understand the needs of others. I have owned my own small company and have worked for an old and established company, often as a top producer allowing me the opportunity to list and sell properties at various price points throughout Berkshire County. Due in part to my strength in negotiating and closing skills my customers and clients are happy to refer friends and family members. I have developed a strong referral business which has been essential in becoming a successful broker. I have developed relationships with local tradesman who are happy to reply quickly to the requests of my clients. I am a licensed broker in both New York and Massachusetts. I am married and have two grown sons, two beautiful daughters-in-law and two incredible grandchildren. My husband and I enjoy overseeing our own real estate investments, time on our boat, and traveling.

remarks.remark: In 1975 I discovered the Northwest Hills while visiting relatives who had moved here. I was taken by its beauty and by the people themselves. I continued to visit 3 to 4 times a year. In the early 80’s I moved up to Lakeville CT before going back to the NY metro area after 2 years. I made a vow to someday move back to the area and in 2000 that move came true. I have lived in Salisbury CT since then. After a varied career which included Wall Street, construction and owning a commuter coffee shop, I joined the Real Estate world in 2006 with John Harney Associates. I was one of the top producers with the firm from the start. The firm joined Sotheby’s in 2013. I stand ready to help you with all of your real estate needs. I will be honest to a fault with my clients even at the risk of losing a sale. My goal is to make sure that all of my clients are pleased with the service provided no matter if they be buyers or sellers.

remarks.remark: As one of Westchester's top 100 real estate agents, Michele Fox brings her successful and winning approach to every client.Michele has developed a stellar reputation with buyers, sellers, fellow agents and local vendors alike who enjoy her accessibil ity, honesty and genuine passion for matching the right family with the right home. She successfully adapts her years of experience as a corporate writer to create stand-out marketing materials and a strong web presence. Her creative negotiating and problem solving skills are among the hallmarks of this agent's exceptional approach to sales. Michele is passionate about connecting clients and residents with similar interests. It is an excellent example of her absolute dedication to quality service before, during and after the sales process. A lifelong Larchmont resident and parent, Michele brings to the table unique community insights coupled with a wealth of contacts in Larchmont, Mamaroneck and New Rochelle. She is articulate about the nuances/assets of each area. Additionally, Michele has served as a school board volunteer. Michele's residency, coupled with a decade of area sales experience, make her the "go-to" real estate agent for Larchmont and surrounding areas. She is an active member of an extensive co-brokerage group of renowned agents throughout the tri-state area which provides her the perfect venue for establishing contacts for her buyers and enhancing visibility for her listings.Of special note, Michele is a seasoned homeowner/renovator who possesses first-hand experience in working with contractors, inspectors and zoning boards from a homeowner's perspective. Michele holds numerous platinum-level National Association of Realtors awards. She attended Finch College in Manhattan, graduated from Marymount College (Tarrytown, New York) and has completed several post-graduate writing and marketing courses at Rice University in Texas and New York University. In Michele's spare time you might find her walking through the Village, sailing or painting local landscapes.

remarks.remark: Peter W. Cowie is fortunate to have thoroughly loved both of his longtime careers - first as Vice President of North America for a large European paper group based in Stamford, CT and for the past decade, as a real estate specialist selling wonderful Connecticut shoreline area homes. While Peter sometimes still can't believe he gets paid for what he does, his greatest reward is not just the gratification he gets from his work; it's the appreciation he is shown from loyal clients, many with whom he's formed lasting relationships. While Peter enjoyed extensive travel to Europe for his previous position, he also always loved coming home to his beautiful waterfront home in Guilford. His enthusiasm and knowledge of the market have been evidenced by his standing for five consecutive years as the top one or two producer in sales volume for the area. Peter believes it's his passion for his community that shines through when showing customers around, and the fun he has selling real estate, that are his strongest sales tools. People feel comfortable working with him, because he takes them on tours of the different neighborhoods, educates them on the history of the area and the market, and lets them make decisions in their own time. Sometimes though, Peter will prod you to see a home you may not have otherwise considered, just because he knows his territory - and his clients' needs so well. In many of these cases, there have been offers on the spot! Peter heads a professional team, Peter W. Cowie and Associates, that covers that gamut of real estate services for clients seeking or selling properties on the Connecticut waterfront and inland. Since each home and situation near the water is so unique, he employs a custom approach to marketing and pricing that will draw the greatest demand. A resident of Sachem's Head in Guilford with his wife, Peter is an avid golfer, and a member of both the Clinton Country Club and Sachem's Head Yacht Club. He and his wife Jennifer also enjoy spending as much time as possible with their two sons, and two grandsons, who live just a few miles away.For eighteen years I was the North America Vice President for a major European Paper Group headquartered in Paris, France. For the past six years I've used that experience to become one of the elite high end agents along the Shoreline.I have consistently been among the sales leaders in our area.Peter W. While Peter enjoyed extensive travel to Europe for his previous position, he also always loved coming home to his beautiful waterfront home in Guilford. His enthusiasm and knowledge of the market have been evidenced by his s tanding for five consecutive years as the top one or two producer in sales volume for the area. Peter believes it's his passion for his community that shines through when showing customers around, and the fun he has selling real estate, that are his strongest sales tools. People feel comfortable working with him, because he takes them on tours of the different neighborhoods, educates them on the history of the area and the market, and lets them make decisions in their own time. Sometimes though, Peter will prod you to see a home you may not have otherwise considered, just because he knows his territory - and his clients' needs so well. In many of these cases, there have been offers on the spot! Peter heads a professional team, Peter W. Cowie and Associates, that covers that gamut of real estate services for clients seeking or selling properties on the Connecticut waterfront and inland. Since each home and situation near the water is so unique, he employs a custom approach to marketing and pricing that will draw the greatest demand. A resident of Sachem's Head in Guilford with his wife, Peter is an avid golfer, and a member of both the Clinton Country Club and Sachem's Head Yacht Club. He and his wife Jennifer also enjoy spending as much time as possible with their two sons, and two grandsons, who live just a few miles away.

remarks.remark: Veteran realtor Anita Schilling launched her real estate career in Ft. Lauderdale, Florida before moving to the Berkshires 15 years ago. A native New Yorker, she grew up in a Catskill resort. Anita is widely respected among her colleagues and clients for her depth of knowledge and understanding of the local market, for her acumen in helping both buyers and sellers and her patient, thorough, soft-spoken approach to getting the job done right. As a former entrepreneur and seasoned businesswoman, her background includes building, renovating and managing six franchise operations, with 90 employees. Keep your eye on the goal, work daily toward that goal. Treat everyone with respect and undivided attention. Honest patience goes a long way. Produced high volume stores and received honors for employee service. Help raise funds for Construct, an organization that provides assistance to families in need of housing, fuel assistance and education. My greatest accomplishment is my family. My real estate career began in South Florida, transferring the experience to the Berkshires 15 years ago. Finding this area a perfect place to live, for its beauty, culture and wonderful people, I stayed, calling this my home. My first career was in the hospitality business, taking on the challenge of purchasing a fast food franchise to construct six stores at the age of thirty.

remarks.remark: BUY, SELL or RENT I am ready to help you with your next move! Living in Westchester for so many years has allowed me to develop an expertise in the communities of southern Westchester. I work with both buyers and sellers from the Rivertowns to the Long Island Sound and all towns in between. I appreciate all that Westchester has to offer and I enjoy the uniqueness of each of the different communities and areas. As a realtor, I have specialized in all types of residential properties and have successfully helped both buyers and sellers with their single family homes, condos and co-op apartments. In addition, I also specialize in residential rentals and have completed over 100 rental transactions in my career. I have helped clients relocate to Westchester from all over the US and overseas, including but not limited to Argentina, China, Czech Republic, France, Italy, Singapore, Switzerland and the United Kingdom. Please feel free to contact me for both your local Westchester Real Estate needs and your out of Westchester and out-of-state Real Estate needs. I can help you no matter where you are leaving and where you are going! About Me & My Community Involvement: I have been active in the various schools and PTAs that my 3 children have attended. My involvement began at the nursery/pre-school level, and then on to elementary school involvement. I believe that each child's needs must be matched with the appropriate school experience. As a result, I have experienced both area public schools and private schools as I matched each of my children to the best program for their individual strengths and needs. I am also very active in my neighborhood association and a Board Member of the Association. I have chaired many different community events over the years including the Annual Progressive Dinner, as well as various events for children. I am an avid golfer and member of the Ladies Golf Association at my country club. I also enjoy cycling and recently partook in the NYC 5 Boro Bike Tour (40 miles) and the Westchester Golden Apple Ride (34 miles). I also enjoy spending time with family and friends.

remarks.remark: Wow! I just realized I am celebrating 28 years as a Realtor. A take on an old saying...."time flies when you enjoy your work." These past years are filled with memories of the people I have met, sellers moving on to a larger space or selling a lifetime of memories and downsizing. I also cherish helping buyers buy their dream home or first time buyers realizing the American Dream of homeownership. Such emotional high's and low's can make the process from making the offer to getting to the closing very demanding, I have the ability to guide my clients through to a happy ending! This ability has been ever evolving through my client relationships which have taught me to listen, communicate and always act on their best behalf. On a personal note my life is filled with the love of family I have 3 children and 9 grandchildren. I love golf, kayaking, knitting and playing bridge..and I pride myself on keeping up with all of today's technology. My husband, Don, has re-invented his lifelong career in print sales and joined me to form a dynamic team. He brings a fresh outlook and powerful marketing skills to keep us current along with his irresistible Southern Charm! Don and I look forward to helping you with all of your real estate needs.

remarks.remark: I'm looking forward to working with you! I pride myself on being a broker who works tirelessly to satisfy my clients' needs with the utmost of integrity. For the past 14 years, I have really enjoyed the pleasure of bringing buyers and sellers together and find it most gratifying when a successful conclusion is reached. I specialize in residential real estate in Westchester County, New York, but I can help you buy or sell real estate anywhere in the world. I have been selected to be in the Julia B. Fee Sotheby's International Realty Producers Club for being in the top 5% of all producers industry-wide in Westchester County and in the top 20% of all producers within the entire William Pitt and Julia B. Fee Sotheby's International Realty organization spanning Westchester, Connecticut and the Berkshires. I graduated from Harvard Law School with a J.D. after earning a B.A. in economics from Northwestern University where I earned Phi Beta Kappa honors. I worked as a Real Estate Attorney at the law firms of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison and Fried, Frank, Harris, Shriver & Jacobson before becoming a full-time Associate Real Estate Broker. The expertise I gained as a real estate attorney has helped me provide outstanding service to my real estate clients looking to buy and sell single family homes, condominiums, co-ops and new construction/renovation. The negotiating skills that I perfected as a real estate attorney have been a tremendous help to my real estate clients in buying and selling their homes. I provide total transaction expertise to buyers from showing to closing and to sellers from listing to closing. I have lived in Westchester County for almost 25 years, and can provide the right mix of knowledge, expertise, experience and compassion to help you with your next move. I am active in my community and was heavily involved in the Scarsdale public schools when my three children attended. I am an avid tennis player and enjoy spending time with my family and close friends. To contact Alisa call her at 914.588.9561 or email her at alisa.kaplan@juliabfee.com. Her office is located in the heart of the Village of Scarsdale at 28 Chase Road, Scarsdale, NY 10583.

remarks.remark: I have always lived in Manhattan. Growing up my family spent weekends and summers in upstate New York. It was then that I came to realize that while Manhattan is the best place on earth, I was a more balanced person when I was able to experience the peace, slower pace, and the absolutely joy of being around natural beauty. As an adult I found Litchfield County as my counterbalance to NYC and I have become its biggest advocate. I have been a part-time resident here for 10 years and I am constantly discovering new reasons to love it. Until recently I owned a Pilate’s studio in New York which offered specialized and boutique services to a demanding clientele. Each client was unique so I customized the program to address his/her special needs. I know the key to any business success is understanding the customer needs and providing the best possible service to satisfy them. I am thrilled to be at William Pitt Sotheby’s International Realty and a part of the highly regarded Goldspiel Group. The philosophy that Ira Goldspiel espouses is that each property deserves a customized marketing plan and a team of people who can best market, show and sell it. Each detail is important: photography, copy, advertising, exposure on the internet, weekly analysis of results and networking within and outside our organization. Goldspiel manages the process and selects the best local and corporate people to make it all happen. His superb record proves this approach works. If you are thinking of listing and/or selling a property I am eager to discuss and outline the process. Or if you just want an update describing the current marketplace and get our insights into where we think the market is heading, I would love to bring you up-to-date. Our resources are the best in the business and I look forward to being able to show you how William Pitt Sotheby's is the best brokerage to deliver your real estate needs.

remarks.remark: Kori Sassower is an associate broker operating out of Julia B Fee’s Sotheby’s Rye Office. By combining a dedicated, results-oriented approach with deep local experience and strong technical knowledge, Kori serves as an expert advisor and trusted fiduciary to real estate buyer, sellers and developers across Westchester and Fairfield County. Her broad experience encompasses residential sales, co-ops, new construction short sales and commercial sales. Kori is the #1 agent in total sales volume in Rye Brook in 2017. Kori has been recognized as a Top 40 Agent in Westchester Country and is in the top 1% of all agents within her company. Kori has also been recognized by Westchester Home Magazine, Westchester Family and The New York Times. Kori is a highly successful entrepreneur and real estate professional with nearly two decades of marketing and sales experience. Kori spent fifteen years in senior marketing, sales research and finance roles at Sony Pictures Entertainment where she rose to Director of Pricing and Planning at the cable network subsidiary, GSN. Following her tenure at Sony, Kori founded Momentum Classroom, the award-winning Westchester based youth fitness boutique, where she was recognized for her ground-breaking work with children. Kori is deeply entrenched within the Westchester community with a strong local influence. Kori is a duly licensed associate real estate broker in NY & CT. She received her B.S. in Consumer Studies from Syracuse University and lives in Rye Brook, NY with her husband and three children. For more information on Kori, please visit her website at http://www.korisassower.com/.

remarks.remark: My greatest joy in selling real estate is the quest for the perfect house for my client. Having the ability to see the potential of a property before the client is a gift I treasure and one that has helped me become the realtor that I am. Listening to clients and understanding their needs, dreams, determining their price point and then producing THAT PROPERTY is what drives me to work each day on their behalf. My own homes have been the cover and lead stories in national magazines and newspapers and I am delighted to share them with potential clients in order to form an idea of what they truly want in their own home. In actuality, finding a charming Cape with the potential to be a great house is just as satisfying to me as a million-dollar sale. Litchfield County, especially the Golden Triangle, is rife with these potential transformations. My background and career in fashion enables me to see the fabric of a house and to envision the end result long before the client. As a Litchfield resident, my twenty-year involvement with my community affords me the knowledge of the best of what Litchfield County has to offer. Being on the board of the Community Center, my work with the local library and having served as a Burgess for the Borough of Litchfield have only added to my passion for my village and the people who reside there. It would be my pleasure to share with you my knowledge and expertise in the search for your perfect new home.

remarks.remark: For me, being a Licensed Associate Real Estate Broker is about more than just buying or selling a home. It is about establishing relationships, and helpingbuyers and sellers achieve their goals. I have been representing both buyers and sellers in real estate transactions since 2004. I was Rookie of the year, during my first year in business. Buying or selling real estate is a business decision, in which emotion plays a big role. By choosing to work with me, you can be assured that I am reliable and a good listener. I am dedicated to providing my clients with guidance and patience throughout the entire process. Prior to my decision to enter the real estate field, I was a credit officer with a major Wall Street Firm, where I was responsible for making business recommendations based on the financial condition, and stability of large financial corporations. The analytical skills I acquired serve me well in my chosen profession, allowing me to assist both buyers and sellers in making educated real estate decisions. In addition, I have a mortgage banking background. I have lived in lower Westchester all of my life, and therefore I know the communities well. I currently live in the Edgewood section of Scarsdale with my husband and 3 children since 1992. I enjoy working out, figure skating, and spending time with my family. I am a dedicated volunteer at Kids Kloset, an organization committed to providing poverty stricken children in Westchester County with essentials. I am an active Member of the Scarsdale PTA. Serving Scarsdale, Edgemont, Eastchester, Tuckahoe Hartsdale, Bronxville, White Plains, and the North End of New Rochelle.

The analytical skills I acquired serve me well in my chosen profession, allowing me to assist both buyers and sellers in making educated real estate decisions.  In addition, I have a mortgage banking background.<BR/><BR/>I have lived in lower Westchester all of my life, and therefore I know the communities well.  I currently live in the Edgewood section of Scarsdale with my husband and 3 children since 1992.  I enjoy working out, figure skating, and spending time with my family.  I am a dedicated volunteer at Kids Kloset, an organization committed to providing poverty stricken children in Westchester County with essentials.  I am an active Member of the Scarsdale PTA.<BR/><BR/>Serving Scarsdale, Edgemont, Eastchester, Tuckahoe Hartsdale, Bronxville, White Plains, and the North End of New Rochelle.<BR/><BR/>

remarks.remark: An international transplant who was born in China and grew up in Hong Kong, Jessica has lived in many places including Los Angeles, San Francisco, Chicago, and most recently Manhattan and Long Island City, before settling in Westchester to raise her family. The agent-of-choice for both home sellers and buyers in Westchester County, Jessica is passionate about the beautiful living Westchester has to offer. Most recently an executive at a leading global luxury beauty company for nine years, Jessica is well known for her strategic insights that create unique product messaging, robust marketing campaigns, her creative problem solving and negotiation skills, and her unmatched understanding of the nuanced and unspoken needs of the most discerning consumers around the world. An expert marketer who believes in premium products and services, Jessica is proud to be part of Sotheby's International Realty. Jessica's motto is to deliver a world-class experience with the utmost level of confidentiality and integrity to each and every client. Jessica directly serves her clients in Westchester County and around the world through her highly selective group of global real estate expert partners. Jessica has a BA from University of California, Berkeley and an MBA from Northwestern University. She currently resides in Scarsdale with her husband and two sons. William Pitt Sotheby's International Realty

remarks.remark: Personal Information Born and raised in Connecticut, Sue resides in Old Lyme with her husband, Alain and their Rhodesian Ridgeback, Socrates. Her affinity for the shoreline began when she was a child, staying at her great-grandparents' home at Stannard Beach. Through her teen years, Sue enjoyed visiting friends and family at our many shoreline beaches. Having lived and worked in Stamford and NYC, Sue's knowledge of Connecticut is vast and extends beyond Fairfield and Hartford Counties. Sue has traveled internationally and met her husband while touring in Italy. Together, they lived in Antibes, France and sold luxury real estate on the Cote d'Azur. After experiencing life on the French Riviera, Sue and Alain returned to the shoreline where she focuses on waterfront properties and beach communities. Business Philosophy Sue's passion for real estate shows in her enthusiasm and commitment. Realizing that every buying and selling situation is different, Sue focuses on understanding each client's needs and desires. Honesty, integrity and service are in the forefront of all of her business dealings. Receiving holiday cards from buyers and sellers, years after closing, puts a huge smile on her face and is a true testament to Sue's customer focused philosophy. Whether the sale involves a waterfront mansion or a one-bedroom condo, Sue feels every client deserves the same commitment and dedication. She takes pride in working with buyers regardless of their budget and, even afterclosing, Sue is always available to assist clients in acclimating to their new home and community. Accomplishments Sue sold over $55,000,000 in real estate in Connecticut and the South of France. Her real estate experience began with listing and selling multi-million Euro properties on The French Riviera. Sue assisted International buyers with purchasing luxury properties ranging in price from 1€ to 15€ million. Prior to joining William Pitt Sotheby's International Realty, Sue worked for a national builder selling semi-custom single-family homes in Mystic and Southington, Connecticut. Sue has helped many clients with interior renovations and design. Although Sue began her career working with corporate clients from Fortune 1000 companies, she utilizes her sales experience, marketing expertise and excellent negotiating skills in her real estate transactions. Sue holds a Bachelor's degree from Tulane University and a Master's degree from American University. You can reach Sue on her cell phone anytime at 860.707.6879.

remarks.remark: For Annie Klyver, real estate is part of her family. Her grandmother owned her own real estate company in Needham, Massachusetts, and her mother-in-law was a realtor in Southport at Nicholas Fingelly Real Estate. In 2001, Annie became a member of the National Association of Realtors, the Greater Fairfield Board of Realtors and the Connecticut Association of Realtors. Raised in Fairfield County, Annie has a personal knowledge of the homes in this area. She contributes her success to her in-depth knowledge of the community, her market knowledge, as well as her willingness to always put her clients first. Most of her clients are referrals from friends, and she takes great pride in finding them a home where they will be happy for many years. Additionally, Annie’s husband is a local architect and together they have improved many of their own homes. With this experience she was a thorough knowledge of the costs involved in renovating, and how these improvements can add to the future value of a home. When working with Annie, you know you will be in good hands. She treats the whole experience as though she were purchasing or selling her own home. If you are purchasing a home, she will look for all the advantages and disadvantages of the property, and she will make sure you are well informed. If you are selling your property, she will be as honest and realistic as possible so you are not disappointed in the process. Annie has three boys and lives in the Greenfield Hill neighborhood of Fairfield.

remarks.remark:
Tina Pierce has experienced all the excitement and challenges that are unique to investing or moving to resort communities, such as our beautiful Amelia Island! She grew up visiting her grandmother in Fernandina Beach, spending many happy hours building sand castles and jumping waves. Along the way, Tina fell in love with our island and has watched it become a mecca for wildlife enthusiasts and playground for automobile aficionados; as well as offer an exceptional quality of life for those fortunate enough to live here.
Prior to moving to Amelia Island, Tina was a healthcare executive whose career provided opportunities to live in some of the most beautiful places in the world: Boulder, Colorado; Brisbane, Australia; Palo Alto, California to name a few. Professionally, Ms. Pierce acquired construction and design expertise leading cancer center construction projects. In addition, she has custom-built or remodeled her own homes, including a complete redesign of her Amelia Island home.
Tina’s expertise in the healthcare industry fostered her ability to build genuine relationships with people. You will experience exceptional dedication as she works with you to acquire a sound business investment or a home that nurtures a dream… or offers a haven from the corporate world. Personalized service and individualized attention to detail illustrate her style. Ms. Pierce has a BS in Dietetics and Nutrition from Rochester Institute of Technology in Rochester, NY and a MBA from the Leeds School of Business in Boulder, CO. Tina travels internationally, is passionate about fitness and prefers spending leisure time with the loves of her life. Amelia Island is tops on her list!

remarks.remark: Marilyn Berman: Respected, Referred, Results Marilyn has lived in Edgemont for over 40 years with her husband, pediatrician Dr. Morton Berman, and their three children, all graduates of Edgemont High School. She is a former antiques dealer and interior designer, a skill that helps new buyers envision the possibilities of a new home and also guides sellers in staging their home for sale. She has given the same commitment to her community as she does to real estate, serving as Edgemont PTA President and board member of the Edgemont Scholarship Council, Scarsdale Adults School and the Scarsdale/Edgemont Family Counseling Service. Marilyn is a full time, experienced realtor specializing in the sale and purchase of residences at all price levels throughout Westchester County, particularly Scarsdale, Edgemont, White Plains, Hartsdale, Briarcliff and the river towns of Hastings, Ardsley, Dobbs Ferry and Irvington. For sellers she is 100% committed to getting the highest price and best terms available, achieved by using her creative marketing and sharp negotiating skills. She believes that whether you are buying or selling a home, selecting the right real estate agent can make the process a very successful and pleasant experience. For buyers, she provides honest advice, accurate information, patience and perseverance to help them find the best home for their needs and desires. She is an expert in assessing market conditions and price evaluations. Both buyers and sellers get dedication, honesty and professional first class service- from start to finish! Her success in real estate is due to her outgoing personality, warmth, energy, and commitment to achieving perfection. Marilyn’s strong negotiating and marketing skills have earned her the respect of both local and global clients. She has often said that client referrals are her greatest reward. Marilyn is a member The National Association of Realtors, N.Y. State Association of Realtors, Westchester County Board of Realtors and the Westchester/Putnam Multiple Listing Service.

remarks.remark: Don Shannehan is a dedicated Full time- Full service realtor, who demonstrates deep knowledge of the marketplace,continually provides due diligence to buyers and sellers, constantly keeps two-way communications, employs sharp and skillful negoiation abilities, and always prides his ability to be a good listener to his clients.. Mr. Shannehan works with his wife, Kathy, as a team with over 30 years of experience in real estate sales. This gives you, as a client, rapid responses to questions, meetings, showings, open houses, inspections, negotiations and whatever comes along during the overall experience. Working with this strong brand, William Pitt Sotheby's and its unparalleled technology and worldwide reach, it gives you even more team support. The Shanehan's have been living in Essex for more than 15 years enjoying the lifestyle and community involvement that earned Essex as one of " America's Best Small Cities". Don is the "Secret Keeper" of Donnie's Down Home BBQ Sauce and Spice Rub Company. Don has been the past Vice Commodore of the Essex Corinthian Yacht Club and presently the club's Kayak leader of the Connecticut River and Long Island Sound excursions and is a current member of the Pettipaug Yacht Club. Also, he was a Board Member of the Old Lyme Country Club. Currently, Don is a member of the Executive Board of the Essex Board of Trade, and the Executive Board of The Essex Historical Society. Mr. Shannehan is a graduate of Georgia State University and a proud Vietnam Veteran of the United States Marine Corps.

remarks.remark: Born and raised on the shoreline of Connecticut, Kate is now proud to call Litchfield County her home. After recently purchasing and renovating a home in Litchfield County, Kate understands the remodeling process and can help buyers looking for a project or renovation. Kate enjoys working with people to educate and assist them in fulfilling their needs. Her BFA degree in Graphic Design, along with her background in kitchen design, has given her experience in both creative and competitive markets. Having worked in the education field for over ten years, Kate is an expert communicator that can prioritize the needs of a client. Kate is also an active member of the Litchfield County Board of REALTORS, the Connecticut REALTORS, and the National Association of REALTORS. Kate and her family love to spend time hiking in the state parks and land preserves, visiting nearby farms, and playing tennis with her husband, a local tennis pro and coach. She also enjoys the visual and performing arts, boating, and eating out at a variety of topnotch restaurants in the County. Kate always looks forward to sharing her love of the area with clients, and works diligently to meet their needs.
